description:
Allianz Trade, the world’s leading provider of credit insurance services, helps its customers around the globe to trade wisely and develop their business safely. With 6,000 employees from more than 70 nationalities, in over 50 countries, Allianz Trade offers a complete range of services for the management of B-to-B trade receivables. For more information visit http://www.allianz-trade.com/ Allianz Trade is engaged in a major IT transformation since 2018/2019 with strong IT investments foreseen up to end of 2028. In addition, as part of GO 2025 ambition, additional investments have been decided to improve customer satisfaction and support growth ambition in particular in Surety. As a consultative committee of the BoM, the PIC teams’ purpose is to take major investment decisions in alignment with the strategy and financial performance of Allianz Trade, by reviewing, challenging and preparing investment requests before submitting to the Board of Management, and by providing visibility on overall project portfolio status. Working in direct contact with colleagues from various Functions and Regions, you will interact with C-level management in a fully international environment.As a Senior Portfolio Analyst, your main tasks will beEnsure that the PIC process – which is a statutory obligation – is running smoothly and properlyDrive the Budget process for all IT & non-IT projects – understand the project requirements, challenge the budget needs (incl. strategic project selection, budget definition, …)Provide a complete project portfolio overview (budget, project insights, business case information, business value and strategy relation, etc.) to C-level/Board of Management to discuss with/support them in their project selection. Manage Project Investment approval process and support Allianz Trade Board in this process Ensure project Monitoring & Decom TrackingDefine, establish and manage operational monitoring process and provides quarterly reports to the Board of ManagementManage : IT Projects KPIs; Tracking of legacy decommissioning projects (operational progress & financials) and reporting to Allianz; tracking of IT savings and business benefits expected from legacy decommissioning Program; IT projects benefitsContribute : to Productivity Dialog on all aspects of IT project portfolio; to Allianz ITCO preparation and reporting for all in scope Allianz Trade projectsSupport : Budget monitoring, actuals and forecast for all IT Projects while providing analysis of the figures; support Finance in the quarterly closure on project scope & reporting to Allianz Portfolio OverviewDefine and implement a Project Portfolio Management and governance process which fully transparent and easy to understandProvide a complete Project Portfolio overview and quarterly progress status updates in all aspectsImplement a Project Management tool to manage the Project Portfolio and all relevant linked processes, incl. change tracking, etc. and drive continuous improvements considering user and consumer aspectsEnsure that all relevant program/project information is available and up-to date in the used toolProvide regular portfolio overview to group and regional stakeholders KPIs dashboard: Ensure production of Ops & IT KPIs dashboard; maintain and improve them Key experience required / key skillsAbility to rally, liaise, coordinate, collaborate with various stakeholders in a multicultural environmentRecognized experience in managing projects or program, ideally on large international projects (Preferred: agile methodologies) and ability to challenge experienced project managersA combination of business, finance and IT acumen, or a taste to learn those dimensionsIn depth experience in project portfolio managementVery good understanding of controlling processesStrong analysis capabilities (e.g. opportunity studies, including business cases and business requirement analysis)Problem solving skills, curiosityAbility to step backAbility to furnish continuous improvementStrong reporting and presentation skills (Excel and PowerPoint required)Good communicationAbility to work independentlyEnglish written and spoken, another language is a plusIf you are interested in the position above and think you have the right profile please follow the online application process. For more detailed information on the company and our career opportunities please go to our website: Careers | Working at Allianz Trade (allianz-trade.com)

Vous souhaitez rejoindre un Groupe dont la Raison d'Être résonne avec vos propres valeurs d'un monde où les ressources et les Hommes sont au coeur des préoccupations quotidiennes ?Un Groupe dont l'ambition est de participer aux transformations que nous vivons ?Vous recherchez une expérience porteuse de sens dans la finance et qui vous permettra de conjuguer ces ambitions et d'apporter votre expertise dans le domaine des financements ? Alors cette proposition de poste est pour vous !Veolia a pour ambition de devenir l'entreprise de référence en matière de transformation écologique. Notre mission de Ressourcer le monde traduit également l'engagement de nos 220 000 collaborateurs à avoir un impact positif sur notre planète.Au sein du Siège de Veolia, nous nous engageons à responsabiliser nos collaborateurs et collaboratrices en leur donnant les moyens d'être utile et d'avoir un véritable impact. Nous recherchons des collaborateurs qui partagent notre engagement.Devenez acteur de la transformation écologique en nous rejoignant !La Direction Financements Trésorerie Groupe est en charge du financement des filiales/BU dans le respect de la politique de financement et des règles de gestion Groupe.Au sein de la salle des marchés, le/la Financing Analyst participe à la mise en oeuvre du processus du financement des entités du Groupe par le siège. Dans ce cadre, il/elle assiste le Financing Manager à la coordination des différents intervenants afin de répondre aux besoins des entités : Trésorerie, CFO de BU, juridique, fiscalité Il sera de plus le back-up opérationnel du Financing Manager.Détail Des Missions Participation à l'animation du procès de financement interne Groupe Gestions des reporting récurrents du département Soutien aux trésoriers de zone responsables de la formalisation des besoins et leur justification Confirmation des termes et conditions à appliquer Coordination si nécessaire des différents intervenants (Direction Juridique et fiscale, opérateurs de marchés, cash et back office) pour la mise en place des nouveaux financements/ remboursement Suivi du workflow dans l'outil Fineo Saisies des financements dans l'outil Next Suivi administratif de la documentation en coordination avec la Direction Juridique Analyse des problématiques de change associées en collaboration avec les opérateurs de marchés Participation à l'animation du programme de Factoring Groupe (8 pays, 100 entités cédantes) Suivi de la fluidité opérationnelle du programme lors des cessions mensuelles S'assurer de la mise à jour du fichier de suivi du programme Mise à disposition des reportings à destination des BU et du management Gestion des aspects administratifs du programme, en lien avec la Direction Juridique Participation aux missions du Financing Manager Suivi des marchés liés au financement Corporate (marché obligataire, marché des prêts, etc) Maintenance / mise à jour des procédures liées aux sujets de financement : Participation à la mise à jour des conditions de financement Formation : Bac +3 / Bac +5 - Ecole de commerce, formation universitaire Intérêt pour la matière financière et pour connaître les activités du Groupe Expérience souhaitée : Une expérience en trésorerie ou en contrôle financier est souhaitable Compétences requises : Très bonne capacité d'organisation (nombreux dossiers à gérer simultanément) Bonne rédaction écrite et pédagogie (communication constante avec les trésoriers et les BU) Bon relationnel Rigueur et transparence Base en finance d'entreprise et finance de marchés idéalement Langues nécessaires (et niveau) : Très bonne maîtrise de l'anglais à l'oral comme à l'écrit La maîtrise d'une autre langue est un plus (espagnol, chinois) Outils à connaître : Excel indispensable Google Suite : bonne maîtrise souhaitée Lumworks et AppSheet sont un plus Reuters et Bloomberg sont un plus

job_title: Analyste Financier en Alternance - Bac+4 H/F
description:
Vous recherchez une alternance ? Vous recherchez également une formation MBA sur deux ans dans un établissement à Dijon propice à votre développement professionnel et personnel ? Cette offre est faite pour vous !!Notre entreprise partenaire, dans le domaine de la grande distribution, recherche un(e) alternant(e) pour le poste de Analyste Financier.Un poste à pourvoir UNIQUEMENT si vous avez validé un Bac +3 ou si vous êtes en cours de validation de votre Bac +3 dans les domaines de la comptabilité, de la gestion et/ou de la finance.Vos MissionsDans le cadre de votre MBA Expert Administratif et Financier, vous intégrerez notre équipe en tant qu'apprenti(e) Analyste Financier. Sous la supervision de nos experts, vos missions principales seront : Analyser les états financiers des entreprises clientes pour évaluer leur santé financière. Contribuer à la réalisation d'études de marché et à l'évaluation des opportunités d'investissement. Participer à l'élaboration de modèles financiers pour des projets de fusions et acquisitions, de levées de fonds, etc. Assister à la préparation des rapports financiers et des présentations à destination des clients et des investisseurs. Effectuer des recherches sur les tendances économiques, sectorielles et financières pour soutenir les recommandations stratégiques. Collaborer avec les équipes internes pour améliorer les processus d'analyse et de reporting financier.CONTRAT de 2 ans avec un rythme de 3 jours de cours tous les 15j.Votre Profil Vous souhaitez intégrer un nouvel établissement pour un Bac +4 en vu de continuer ensuite sur un Bac +5 en Management du Développement Commercial d'Entreprise. Vous avez une première expérience dans la grande distribution qui vous a permis de développer un sens aigu de l'organisation et du service client. Vous êtes dynamique, rigoureux(se) et doté(e) d'un excellent sens relationnel. Vous êtes motivé(e) par les défis commerciaux et souhaitez évoluer vers des fonctions managériales. Vous avez un bon esprit d'équipe et savez faire preuve d'initiative et d'autonomie.

job_title: Global Equities - Equity Derivatives Payoff Structurer - Analyst
description:
Job DescriptionAs a Structurer in our team, you will look after our large EMEA Sales team focusing on selling Structured Products to private banks, retail distribution channels, family offices and asset managers. You will play a central role in pricing and designing high quality products and supporting both sales and trading in the process.Job SummaryWe are seeking an enthusiastic and motivated individual to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a strong quantitative background, proficiency in Python programming, and excellent interpersonal skills. This role provides an opportunity to work in a dynamic environment, learn about the industry, and deliver innovative solutions for our clients.We are a leading team in Equity Derivative within the sell-side of the financial industry. Our team collaborates closely with Trading, Sales, Quants, Legal, Compliance, Research and Operations to develop and deliver customized solutions that meet our clients’ requirements. Our clients include major Asset Managers, Distributors, Fund managers, and Hedge Funds.Your job as structurer sits between Sales and Trading and you will support both teams on live requests from clients as well as executing transactions. Your strong quantitative background will drive deep conversation with our Quants team to understand pricing models and their limitations and strengths. Your innovative mindset is of utmost importance to think outside the box when designing new products as well as guiding sales and trading to find solutions for challenging problems in your day-to-day tasks.Job ResponsibilitiesIdeate, structure and price Equity Derivative products tailored to client needs for retail investors and asset managers.Collaborate with Sales, Trading, Quants, Legal, Compliance and Operations to ensure seamless execution of Structured Product transactionsWork closely with Trading and Quants in analysing risks of products, and ideate risk management strategies to deployCoordinate with Quants in developing innovative Quantitative Models for structuring and risk management of novel products that address market needsAnalyse market trends and data to inform product development and client strategiesProgram and automate processes using Python to enhance efficiency and accuracyContribute to team’s continuous learning and developmentRequired Qualifications, Capabilities, And SkillsDegree in Engineering, Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics, FinanceBasic understanding of Derivatives, with robust foundational knowledge (Futures, Forward, Vanilla Options. Exotics is a plus)Strong quantitative, analytical and communication skillsPreferred Qualifications, Capabilities, And SkillsPrior experience or internships in Derivatives role, particularly Equity DerivativesABOUT USJ.P. Morgan is a global leader in financial services, providing strategic advice and products to the world’s most prominent corporations, governments, wealthy individuals and institutional investors. Our first-class business in a first-class way approach to serving clients drives everything we do. We strive to build trusted, long-term partnerships to help our clients achieve their business objectives.We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. We also make reasonable accommodations for applicants’ and employees’ religious practices and beliefs, as well as mental health or physical disability needs. Visit our FAQs for more information about requesting an accommodation.About The TeamThe Corporate & Investment Bank is a global leader across investment banking, wholesale payments, markets and securities services. The world’s most important corporations, governments and institutions entrust us with their business in more than 100 countries. We provide strategic advice, raise capital, manage risk and extend liquidity in markets around the world.Clients turn to our industry-leading Markets, Sales and Research team to offer clients unique market insights on sectors and companies, and actionable ideas using research to make well-informed investment decisions. Teams understand products across asset classes and help clients structure solutions that manage risk, enhance yield and solve complex financial problems.

We are looking for a talented professional to join us in the pivotal role of P&C Risk Analyst.As a P&C Risk Analyst, you will play a crucial role in analyzing, modeling, and aggregating the Group's risks, as well as defining processes to limit undertaken risks and optimize Group protections.Your Mission Focus on the Solvency 2 process, where you'll act as the Group referent  Identify and understand the needs, priorities, and strategies of the AXA entities and at Group level regarding the capital requirements for the P&C business.  Supporting AXA entities in defining capital optimisation strategies.  Challenge capital requirement calculations, support modelling improvement, and ensure process and validation is performed effectively.  You will have the opportunity to define the risks methodologies for instance in large losses, Reserve or CAT man-made framework (political risk and war, terrorism, riots etc), implement actuarial methodologies, develop models and ensure the validation of local assumptions. Identify relevant internal and external data to support risk assessment.  You will support the definition of the Product and Reinsurance profitability framework, and implement actuarial methodologies while challenging and validating the impact analysis with local entities, Finance and Ceded Re.  You will evaluate and lead analysis projects from start to finish, using internal resources or working with external suppliers. Allianz Trade, the world’s leading provider of credit insurance services, helps its customers around the globe to trade wisely and develop their business safely. With 6,000 employees from more than 70 nationalities, in over 50 countries, Allianz Trade offers a complete range of services for the management of B-to-B trade receivables. For more information visit http://www.allianz-trade.com/ Allianz Trade is engaged in a major IT transformation since 2018/2019 with strong IT investments foreseen up to end of 2028. In addition, as part of GO 2025 ambition, additional investments have been decided to improve customer satisfaction and support growth ambition in particular in Surety. As a consultative committee of the BoM, the PIC teams’ purpose is to take major investment decisions in alignment with the strategy and financial performance of Allianz Trade, by reviewing, challenging and preparing investment requests before submitting to the Board of Management, and by providing visibility on overall project portfolio status. Working in direct contact with colleagues from various Functions and Regions, you will interact with C-level management in a fully international environment.As a Senior Portfolio Analyst, your main tasks will beEnsure that the PIC process – which is a statutory obligation – is running smoothly and properlyDrive the Budget process for all IT & non-IT projects – understand the project requirements, challenge the budget needs (incl. strategic project selection, budget definition, …)Provide a complete project portfolio overview (budget, project insights, business case information, business value and strategy relation, etc.) to C-level/Board of Management to discuss with/support them in their project selection. Manage Project Investment approval process and support Allianz Trade Board in this process Ensure project Monitoring & Decom TrackingDefine, establish and manage operational monitoring process and provides quarterly reports to the Board of ManagementManage : IT Projects KPIs; Tracking of legacy decommissioning projects (operational progress & financials) and reporting to Allianz; tracking of IT savings and business benefits expected from legacy decommissioning Program; IT projects benefitsContribute : to Productivity Dialog on all aspects of IT project portfolio; to Allianz ITCO preparation and reporting for all in scope Allianz Trade projectsSupport : Budget monitoring, actuals and forecast for all IT Projects while providing analysis of the figures; support Finance in the quarterly closure on project scope & reporting to Allianz Portfolio OverviewDefine and implement a Project Portfolio Management and governance process which fully transparent and easy to understandProvide a complete Project Portfolio overview and quarterly progress status updates in all aspectsImplement a Project Management tool to manage the Project Portfolio and all relevant linked processes, incl. change tracking, etc. and drive continuous improvements considering user and consumer aspectsEnsure that all relevant program/project information is available and up-to date in the used toolProvide regular portfolio overview to group and regional stakeholders KPIs dashboard: Ensure production of Ops & IT KPIs dashboard; maintain and improve them Key experience required / key skillsAbility to rally, liaise, coordinate, collaborate with various stakeholders in a multicultural environmentRecognized experience in managing projects or program, ideally on large international projects (Preferred: agile methodologies) and ability to challenge experienced project managersA combination of business, finance and IT acumen, or a taste to learn those dimensionsIn depth experience in project portfolio managementVery good understanding of controlling processesStrong analysis capabilities (e.g. opportunity studies, including business cases and business requirement analysis)Problem solving skills, curiosityAbility to step backAbility to furnish continuous improvementStrong reporting and presentation skills (Excel and PowerPoint required)Good communicationAbility to work independentlyEnglish written and spoken, another language is a plusIf you are interested in the position above and think you have the right profile please follow the online application process.
